Some infrastructure (ducts, local loop unbundling, towers, ect.) sharing is mandated according to remedies to SMP operator (Operator having Significant Market Power) and some is regulated according to general legistlation (all parties negotiate agreements for infrastructure sharing but if they bring dispute to the Communications Regulatory Authority of Republic of Lithuania, we may oblige to provide access to particular services or particular prices).

Yes where an undertaking providing electronic communications network has a right at law to install facilites on, over or under any property, then Malta Communications Authority may impose the sharing of such facilities or property (which may include masts, antennae, towers, ducts, conduits etc) - See article 12 of the Electronic Communications (Regulation) Act - Chapter 399 of the Laws of Malta - this provision came into force in July 2011

Según el Artículo 125 de la Ley Orgánica de Telecomunicaciones, toda persona que de manera exclusiva o predominante posea o controle una vía general de telecomunicaciones, deberá permitir el acceso o utilización de la misma por parte de los operadores que lo soliciten, cuando su sustitución no sea factible por razones físicas, jurídicas, económicas, técnicas, ambientales, de seguridad o de operación.
